intro: Allium perpendiculum, commonly known as the upright garlic or the slender leek, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers on slender stems. Its bulbs are often used as a culinary herb, similar to garlic and leeks. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
